race.name: Grinduro California
race.tagline: OG gravel partyâ€”timed enduro descents, untimed climbs, legendary Quincy vibes since 2015.

vitals.start_time: Saturday morning â€” check official website

climate.description: Mid-September: 50-75Â°F, <10% rain risk, dry and sunny.

terrain.primary: Sierra Nevada enduroâ€”singletrack descents + gravel climbs
terrain.surface: 50% singletrack, 30% gravel, 20% dirt. Enduro format: 4-5 timed technical descents + untimed climbs. MTB skills required. Technical rating: 4/5.

biased_opinion.summary: Grinduro California is party gravel with timed segments. Founded 2015â€”OG location that spawned global Grinduro series (Germany, France, Scotland, Japan). Enduro format: 4-5 timed descents (compete) + untimed climbs (social). 50% singletrack, MTB skills required. 400-600 riders. Quincy small Sierra Nevada town. Legendary post-race partyâ€”beer, music, camping. Vibe: 60% party, 40% race. If you want serious racing, skip it. If you want fun event with technical terrain and epic party, this is bucket-list.
strengths: Unique enduro formatâ€”timed descents, untimed climbs
weaknesses: NOT pure gravelâ€”50% singletrack requires MTB skills
Short distance (60mi) but not serious race
biased_opinion.bottom_line: Grinduro California is party with timed segments. If you want competitive race, skip it. If you want fun event with technical terrain, legendary party, and OG gravel history, this is it. Bring dropbar MTB and party clothes. Timed segments matter if you're competitive, but most people just have fun.

logistics.lodging_note: Quincy small mountain town. Book early. Camping popular and encouraged.
logistics.packet_pickup: Friday packet pickup. Multi-day eventâ€”Friday expo, Saturday race, Saturday night party.
logistics.travel_summary: Reno airport 90 miles. Rental car needed. Quincy small townâ€”book lodging or camping early. Multi-day event (Friday-Saturday). Race Saturday, legendary party Saturday night.
logistics.food_options: Aid stations on course. Post-race party: beer, food, music.

course_description.character: ~60 miles, ~6,500 ft. Enduro format: 4-5 timed descents + untimed climbs. 50% singletrack, 30% gravel, 20% dirt. Technical rating: 4/5. MTB skills required.

suffering_zones.name: 4-5 Timed Enduro Segments (Descents)
suffering_zones.description: Technical descents. Timed. Competitive riders push hard. MTB skills required.
suffering_zones.survival_strategy: 40-45mm tires. Dropbar MTB. Pick lines carefully. Brake late, corner smooth.

suffering_zones.name: Untimed Liaison Climbs
suffering_zones.description: Climbs are social. No racing. Regroup, chat, enjoy. Part of Grinduro vibe.
suffering_zones.survival_strategy: Relax. Social pace. Save energy for timed descents. Enjoy the party.

suffering_zones.name: Technical Singletrack (50% of course)
suffering_zones.description: Singletrack requires MTB skills. NOT pure gravel. Technical.
suffering_zones.survival_strategy: Dropbar MTB or gravel with MTB capability. 40-45mm tires. Tubeless. Skills matter.

course_description.signature_challenge: Enduro formatâ€”timed descents reward MTB skills. Untimed climbs = social. Party vibe.

history.origin_story: Grinduro California founded 2015 in Quincy. OG location. Enduro format: timed descents + untimed climbs + party vibe. Spawned global Grinduro series (Germany, France, Scotland, Japan). 400-600 riders. Legendary post-race party. Quincy small Sierra Nevada town.
history.reputation: OG Grinduro. Party gravel with timed segments. Legendary post-race party.

logistics.explanation: John Watson describes the evolution from 2019's 2000 riders to 2025's more manageable 450 signups as 'intimate, like a family reunion.' Quincy is 90 miles from Reno with limited mountain town lodging that fills up fast. The multi-day format with Friday pickup, Saturday race, and legendary post-race party requires weekend commitment but smaller field sizes have eased the registration anxiety.

length.explanation: The enduro format features four timed segments totaling under 15 miles of racing within 60 total miles. Riders can 'party ride the whole thing and turn it up to eleven on these timed sections and win the entire event.' Stage 1 covers just 1.6 miles while the longest Stage 4 spans 5.6 miles, with untimed liaisons between segments designed for social riding at party pace. More compact than Grinduro. As Stage 1 puts it: "A long, fairly gentle fireroad climb that topped out at just over 1800m altitude. The climbing started right from the start line, but the timed portion was carefully located to mean riders' legs and l..."

technicality.explanation: An elite rider describes Stage 4 as coming 'after 7kms of prior descending on a combination of loose rock, bedrock, gravel and roots' with 'frequent 180 degree hairpinned turns where a lapse in concentration would see you lose skin or plop gently off the edge of the world.' The Big Climb features 'sustained pitches of 18-20%' on 'loose fragments of rock and chunky gravel.' Among the most technical in gravel, on par with Badlands. As Elite Rider puts it: "Pushing a gravel bike up a loose rocky 14-20 percent gradient climb in 29-degree temperatures probably isn't many people's idea of fun, even if it is labelled as a 'Hike-a-bike' challenge..."

elevation.explanation: The 2025 Quincy course packs 7,200 feet of climbing into 51 miles. Stage 1 'Huff-n-Puff' delivers 739 feet of gain in just 1.6 milesâ€”'a gut punch of a climb' according to organizers. The 2022 Mt. Shasta version reached 2027m altitude with one elite rider calling the main ascent 'hideous' due to sustained 18-20% pitches on deteriorating surfaces. More climbing than SBT GRVL at the same score. As Elite Rider puts it: "Pushing a gravel bike up a loose rocky 14-20 percent gradient climb in 29-degree temperatures probably isn't many people's idea of fun, even if it is labelled as a 'Hike-a-bike' challenge..."

climate.explanation: The 2019 race earned the title 'The Four Seasons Bike Race' for delivering rain, cold, sun and snow in one day. An elite rider endured '29-degree temperatures' during the 2022 Big Climb, forcing most riders to walk the technical ascent. Even when conditions start perfect, the Sierra Nevada location can deliver extreme weather variability within a single event. Harsher conditions than Karukinka. As Stage 3 puts it: "Described as a 'rolling gravel stage' by the organisers and was on a forest fireroad."

altitude.explanation: The 2022 Mt. Shasta course topped out at 2027m (6,650 feet) while Quincy sits around 3,500 feet. An elite rider noted the main challenges were technical terrain rather than altitude effects, with the Big Climb's difficulty stemming from 'loose fragments of rock and chunky gravel' on steep grades rather than thin air physiological barriers. Modest altitude compared to Belgian Waffle Ride San Diego.

adventure.explanation: An elite rider describes Stage 2 singletrack as 'twisty, swoopy, flowy' through Redwood forest where 'dust motes floated through the trees' and 'the air was thick with the heady scent of freshly released pine resin.' The Smokechaser stage offers 'flowy Mt. Hough singletrack, a throwback to the original Grinduro' with 2,202 feet of descent over 5.6 miles of technical terrain.

prestige.explanation: John Watson emphasizes this is 'the first of its kindâ€”a gravel race inspired by the enduro race format' that created an entire category spawning international copycats. The original 2015 Grinduro attracts pros like Tiffany Cromwell from Canyon/SRAM, but Watson notes the party-focused atmosphere means 'gravel races killed gravel, but Grinduro proves that nostalgia wins.'

race_quality.explanation: The four-stage format includes meticulously planned segments like King Solomon's Fallâ€”'a consistently ripping descent' covering 2.4 miles and 803 feet of descent on King Solomon Road. Aid stations feature 'an impressive array of food' including 'four main course dishes' and even 'shots of decent strength alcohol.' Cutoff times ensure pacing without traditional endurance race pressure.

experience.explanation: An elite rider declares Stage 2 'some of the most fun singletrack I've ever had the pleasure to ride' where 'if you got to the end without a huge gravel-grin plastered across your face, then you officially had no soul.' The event combines 'excellent food, an impressive display of art and incredible handmade bikes, live music, camping and a festival atmosphere.'

community.explanation: Participants range 'from top pros in full race kit to groups of friends in fancy dress' riding everything from 'big travel full suspension trail bikes to CX bikes with 33mm tyres.' John Watson describes the 2025 atmosphere as 'intimate, like a family reunion' with organizers promoting it as 'the ultimate social gravel race with the perfect party-to-race ratio.'

field_depth.explanation: Taylor Phinney's participation shows elite presence, but the enduro format with party emphasis attracts more adventure-seekers than pure racers. One reader notes winners 'from fast to old' chose mountain bikes over gravel bikes, suggesting equipment matters more than racing pedigree. The 400-600 rider field prioritizes fun over competitive depthâ€”fast riders attend, but not for career-defining results. Similar competitive depth to Rule of Three. As John Watson puts it: "Modern gravel racing, with its heavy-handed handling by professional cycling corporations, has altered gravel."

value.explanation: The entry fee covers a multi-day festival with meals, live music, camping, and mechanical support at aid stations stocked with 'everything from cups of chopped local fruit to shots of decent strength alcohol.' You're paying for the original enduro gravel experience with legendary post-race party atmosphere, but it's expensive for what amounts to under 15 miles of timed racing.

expenses.explanation: Registration runs $150-$200. OriginalJimDog reports 700x40 Maxxis Ramblers handled the course with 'no probs' while competitive riders in 2015 mostly used 40mm WTB Nano tires. An elite rider recommends 'big volume tyres' for technical descents, and many participants bring mountain bikes for the challenging terrain. Quincy requires 90-mile drive from Reno plus early lodging bookings in the small mountain town. Similar expense level to Belgian Waffle Ride San Diego.

final_verdict.one_liner: A party disguised as a race where the descents are timed, the climbs are social, and your bike handling matters more than your FTP.
final_verdict.should_you_race: Come if you want good vibes and can handle singletrack on drop barsâ€”this isn't pure gravel racing. You need actual mountain bike skills for the technical descents and 40-45mm tires that grip. Skip it if you're chasing serious race results or can't ride technical terrain without white knuckling.
final_verdict.alternatives: Try Crusher in the Tushar if you want legitimate gravel racing with climbing, or Sea Otter Grinduro if you prefer the same party format but with better logistics. Both will test your legs more than your bike handling.

primary.name: Maxxis Reaver
primary.why: Technical all-rounder. EXO+ casing shrugs off rocks and roots.

videos.title: Grinduro California 2018 - Quincy
videos.description:
Grinduro 2018 is in the history books now, and thanks to everyone who attended, it was the biggest and best Grinduro yet! From riding along the 60-mile course to jumping in the Swim Hole, to the art galleries, to the gourmet food, afterparty and more, we hope you enjoyed an amazing weekend in Quincy while making new friends, strengthening your #partytoraceratio and #maxinandrelaxin' â€” we certainly did!

All participation and support of Grinduro means that the Sierra Buttes Trail Stewardship will continue their good work in the Sierra, creating trails and jobs that will help bring even more stoke to riders around the world for years to come!

None of the good times or amazing work would be possible without the help of Grinduro's sponsors and supporters. Big thanks to Giro, SRAM, Fabric, WTB and Lauf, as well as the staff and volunteers of Sierra Buttes Trail Stewardship, and all of our expo partners. We thrive as a family and we couldn't be represented by better brands and people.

videos.curation_reason: Comprehensive race experience video with detailed course breakdown and strong viewership showing the unique four-segment format.

videos.title: Grinduro Quincey CA 2025
videos.description:
I raced Grinduro in Quincy this weekendâ€”the full 50-mile gravel grinder, up Mount Hough. The weather was perfect: clear blue skies with just a few clouds.

The course was a mix of fire road climbs through pine forest and long single-track descents. Higher up, we passed through burned sections where only the blackened skeletons of trees remain. The singletrack was dramaticâ€”cut tight into the side of the mountain with sweeping alpine views across the valley. Fast, technical, and a real upper-body workout on a gravel bike.

My race was shaped by flats. Four in total. The trouble began when I misjudged a bunny hop over one of the water channels cut across the fire road. I landed the rear wheel hard, dinged the rim, and the tyre started threatening to unseat itself. After two stops to reseat it, I put in a spare tubeâ€”only to find the spare tube already punctured from sitting too long in my saddle bag. A patch held briefly before failing, and later I picked up a thorn puncture for good measure. Too much time fixing tyres meant I fell back through the field and missed the last timed stage, but I still got around the full course.

Despite that, it was a brilliant ride. My new Redshift suspension stem and seatpost both did their job. No saddle sores, even on a rough course and I was able to achieve a new power record. The new Silca saddle bag was discreet and rattle-free. On the downside, I think Iâ€™ve put a buckle in the rear wheel.

Camping in Quincy wasnâ€™t my preference, but it worked out fine. A new sleeping bag was warm and comfortable, even with heavy dew soaking the outside of the tent and bag in the morning. I only camped Friday nightâ€”packing up dry on Saturday evening meant I avoided dealing with a wet tent.

Dinner was sociable. I met Rich, from the Bay Area, riding an Ibis Ripley he was considering buying. Heâ€™s planning to do the Bovine Classic in a couple of weeks on his Stigmata. I also chatted with Pierre, from Houston via Paris, who owns a collection of custom frames, including two Mosaic titanium builds.

Fifty miles and 7,500 feet of climbing made for a hard day out, but Grinduro delivered: big climbs, amazing singletrack, stunning scenery, and a proper adventureâ€”even if I did spend too much of it with a pump in hand.
videos.curation_reason: Recent first-person race recap with specific course and terrain details despite low view count.

videos.title: Grinduro 2025: Return to Form
videos.description:
This year Grinduro returned to its roots in idyllic Quincy, CA, where it felt small in all the right ways. I got to spend quality time with some of my favorite bike buds and the entire event really felt like a throwback to those special early days at the Plumas-Sierra County Fairgrounds. It wasnâ€™t a nostalgia trip â€” I think everyone there would acknowledge that weâ€™ve all changed. The world has changed. But we showed up this weekend with the desire to recapture that old magic. Like all successful magical acts, all you have to do is believe in it enough to make it come true. Thank you for being magic, Grinduro. 

I rode my new Sklar SuperSomething loaded with a gucci bleep-bloop build kit featuring SRAM Force AXS 13-speed, DT Swiss GRC Dicut wheels, Ritchey Venturemax bars, SimWorks Rhonda stem, Sklar titanium seatpost, and Maxxis Rambler 700x50 tires.

quotes.text: One of the things that's so cool about grindero is that there are four time segments throughout the whole ride or Race So until you get to those segments you do not have to race you can just ride the ride and each segment is completely different from the next there's a road time trial a gravel descent a gravel climb and a single track section so no matter what bike you have you have brought the wrong bike.
